column5: Congrats on an excellent night and PB's for both the salmon and the musky.
Great report. Thanks for sharing your good fortune with us.

It is actually quite common for people to catch muskies in the Fall while casting for kings in the gorge.  I had a friend that fish's the lower river often, he caught (2) muskies last Fall in the Whirlpool area casting for kings with glow spoons.
Excellent report, full of excitmenting details! I too will hit the BOQ soon, good luck to you!

Thanx jwl,they sure do and looking forward to it   yes it most deff was, but i shouldn't be that surprised with this lower river.... it's an amazing fishery!! thanx  Joey   Thanx TbayBoy lol......I was doing  "the right things"   thanx 'R.....R.....'   Thanx Paul ...c ya soon down there   could not of gottem in without ya troit,thnx man lol   Thanx Lew... Now only if i can getem your size     cheers   My pleasure Roy and thank-you   Right on,it sure tripped me out getting one for the first time   Glad you enjoyed it young_one, and Gl to you aswell in BOQ  thanx for your comments Corvette1,solopaddler,mistyriver1,mikethebass,Cudz,Niagara,fishindevil,lunkerbasshunter,mattk,leechman and grimace  cheers all Streamerguy
how can u hold that Musky with just three fingers??LOL good job!
Great pics and commentary.  thanks for posting.  forrest
Balance  and thanx for replying forrest  cheers Streamerguy
Super report and pics.  Congrats on the PB.  Way to go     Certainly a nice surprise eh!!!  Joey
Great report and pics Streamerguy  Congratulation on your PB  Sweet reward Thanks for sharing Leechman
Great first report.  Some real beauties there.  There's a bunch of guys looking for their first muskies doing all "the right things" that are ready to kill you now I thnk
Ha ha! Good stuff, thanks for that and congrats on your pb!
Looks like the night shifts have paid off for you, Sweet fish!!!
Nice array of fish there Streamerguy, well done!

Well i will have to say it has been fun fishing with Streamerguy  , not only for the salmon but for other fish too, he does have a knack for it, as for the salmon that night, was great fishing, on his 30 pounder he had 2 turns left before he was spooled, trying to run along slippery rocks puts a real challenge to it. Most exciting part of the night was the muskie streamerguy brought in, that was 1 heck of a tuff fish, giving him a helping hand with that fish was another challenge just to bring to shore and try and get a measurement or  weigh it,  the things was determined to get away... Looking forward to another great night soon  Cheers  Troit
